intro: Eleocharis minutiflora, commonly known as the minute-flowered spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces tiny, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, inconspicuous flowers. Its roots help stabilize soil in aquatic habitats, contributing to wetland ecosystem health. It is often found in shallow water or damp soil, making it an important component of marsh vegetation.
